title: Prestwick screen protocol

source.title: Pick L4 worms for bleaching (-9 days from first day of tracking)

source.description: Pick 10 x N2 L4s onto 8 x 90mm plates (pre-seeded with OP50)
Prepare 1L low peptone NGM and autoclave

source.title: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates
source.title_html: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"37sqq","text":"C. elegans is maintained in the laboratory on Nematode Growth Medium (NGM) agar which has been aseptically poured into petri plates. The NGM agar medium can be poured into petri plates easily and aseptically using a peristaltic pump. This pump can be adjusted so that a constant amount of NGM agar is dispensed into each petri plate. A constant amount of agar in the plates reduces the need for refocusing the microscope when you switch from one plate to another.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7a41p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70s5t","text":"For imaging purposes, low peptone NGM is prepared which contains less concentration of bactopeptone as compared to the normal NGM. This is because we don't want the seeded bacteria to grow too much and obscure the images, rather just sufficient enough to keep the worms from crawling out of the plate due to lack of food. The imaging plates can be 35mm, 60mm or 90mm in diameter depending on the assay design.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo0e9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27lv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"644a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

source.title: Dispensing agar into multiwell plates
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmd1o","text":"Protocol for pouring agar into 96 well plates using Integra VIAFILL dispenser. Agar should be prepared in advance, and kept in 60oC waterbath until ready to dispense, and whilst dispensing. The X, Y, Z positions for dispensing can be adjusted according to the multiwell plates being used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":129,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
Dry 15 x 150mm plates in cabinet dryer (setting 2) for 3 hours
Seed 15 x 150mm plates with OP50 and leave to dry overnight at room temperature
Bleach worms prepared for day 1 of tracking

source.title: Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aisuj","text":"This protocol is for obtaining synchronised populations of C. elegans. Eggs are harvested from gravid hermaphrodites and allow to grow to L1 arrest for 12-120 hours (0.5-5days). L1 larvae are then fed and left to develop to the appropriate developmental stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":59,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

At 11:00, spin L1s for day 1 of tracking at 2500rpm. Remove supernatent and using glass pipette, drop 4 small droplets around the edges of the plate (off food) onto 14 x 150mm plates
Allow to grow at
See above Step (6) for bleach synchronisation of C. elegans.

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: In the morning, take 40 poured 96 well plates from the cold room, and weigh three random plates without their lids

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: Place in cabinet dryer (setting 2) and allow to dry for 2-3 hours with lids off

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: Weigh 3 random plates and verify that at least 3-5% reduction in weight

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Pre-label dried imaging plates (square well) with the imaging run and drug plate information, so that every plate on a single day of imaging has a unique plate id, for example P01_sh01_01 where:
P01-09 - library plate number (out of 4 library plates)
sh01-04 - shuffle number (out of the 4 shuffled stock plates)
01-07 - imaging run number for that day

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Remove the shuffled library plates (stock) plates from the
freezer, allow to thaw at room temperature and spin to collect contents at bottom of wells

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: Pre-label the skirted 96 well plates with library plate IDs (P01-L09_sh01-sh04) to make up diluted drug plates

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Dispense
water into each well of the prelabeled dilution plates using multichannel pipette and reagent reservoir

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Using VIAFLO (hedgehog) dispenser on BG_STOCK custom program, premix drug in drug library plates in slot A, and then transfer
drug in DMSO to the dilution plates prefilled with water in slot B. Repeat for all drug library plates

source.body:
Double check the dispense volumes before making up the diluted plates
Z-heights have been configured in this program to prevent pipette and plate crashes

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Using VIAFILL (octopus) dispenser, dispense
water onto 5 x predried imaging plates

source.body: 5 plates at a time to prevent the agar absorbing all the liquid before the drug is dispensed into the water droplet

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Using VIAFLO in custom program BG_AGAR, with correct drug library plate in slot B, transfer
of diluted drug and water mixture onto the correctly labelled imaging plate in slot A.
Repeat until all imaging plates have had drug dispensed onto them.

source.body: Z-heights have been configured in this program to prevent pipette tips from piercing the agar

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Prepare 1:10 dilution of OP50 in M9 in a small bottle:
OP50
M9

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description:
Using VIAFILL dispenser, seed all the imaging plates with
per well

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: Place lids on each plate and leave drugged and seeded imaging plates overnight at room temperatue in the dark (with box ontop)
Wash worms off half (7) of the 150mm plates with M9 buffer using pasteur pipette into 15ml falcons
Spin at 1500rpm for 2 minutes to pellet the worms
Remove supernatent and fill with M9
Repeat steps 23-24
After final wash, fill falcon with M9 and transfer contents from 15ml falcon to 3 x 50ml and fill up 30ml with M9
Use COPAS wormsorter to dispense 3 worms per well (pure, no double) into 5 imaging plates at a time. Use pre-made YYYYMMDD_wormsorter.csv to plan and determine which plates to dispense onto

source.title: COPAS wormsorter
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"66sl","text":"Protocol for dispensing adult worms using the COPAS 500 flowpilot","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Allow liquid to dry off by placing imaging plates in
incubator with lid off for 30 minutes, then replace lids and keep in
incubator
Expose worms to drug for 4 hours in total as calculated from the middle wormsorter time and allow worms to acclimate for 30 minutes in the cave prior to imaging

source.body:
Example:
wormsorter start time 10 :00
wormsorter end time 10:40
middle wormsorter time 10:20
cave time 13:50
Imaging start time 14:20

source.description: Imaging on hydra using protocol script (5 mins prestim; 6 mins bluelight with 60 sec OFF, [10sec ON, 90sec OFF] x 3 times; 5 mins postsim)
After 15 plates have been filled with this batch of N2s, repeat steps 23-30 with the other batch of N2s on 150mm plates and record which batch was used in each plate in the wormsorter.csv file.

source.title: Dry plates and dispense drugs onto imaging plates usinv VIAFLO (-1 days from imaging)

source.description: Leave plates to dry for approx 15 mins, so all drugs are absorbed into the agar.

description: Protocol for screening the Prestwick C. elegans drug library of 240 drugs at 3 concentrations and imaging under baseline and bluelight conditions using the Hydra (Loopbio) imaging rigs. All drugs at all concentrations were imaged with N2 in a single day of tracking. This protocol was repeated 3 times so that there were 12 replicates per drug per concentration.
